result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas James Dixon

records.addlTxt: Letter from Judge re: Attorney Fees

11:01 AM Defendant Thomas James Dixon in court.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Thomas James Dixon.  Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State calls Det. Sgt.  Kyle Parish/sworn/direct - witness IDs defendant.  Cross by Bennett.
Bennett statement/Schiek statement/rebuttal by Bennett /Court statement.  Court finds probable cause exists and binds over.
Bail continued.
Arraignment scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Thomas James Dixon
Current: 523 Maple Street, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 09-29-2022)
Prior: 1644 W Davenport St 7, Rhinelander, WI 54501

11:31 AM Defendant Thomas James Dixon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Thomas James Dixon.  Prosecuting Attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes that State's witness is unavailable and Court took motion to amend bond under advisement at last hearing.  Atty Sowinski asking for adjournment due to witness not being available.  Atty Bennett statement to court regarding defendant residence once released.  Atty Bennett states can reside back at 1644 W Davenport #7 until a CBRF place can be found and makes statement about defendant's health issues and asks for signature bond.  Atty Sowinski statement to bond believes some cash is needed and if bond amended that defendant have absolutely no contact with victim and/or with  any juvenile.  Record reflects alleged victim's mother is present in courtroom and States Statute that allows victim's mother to make statement.  Victim's mother makes statement to court - will take full responsibility of defendant if released.  Court questions victim's mother regarding defendant leaving residence except for medical appointments.  Court statement - amends bond to $10,000 Signature Bond with conditions that if defendant is placed in a Community Based Residential Facility for individuals with incapacities or disability that he live at 1644 W Davenport Street #7 and have absolutely no contact of any kind with victim and defendant not leave residence at Davenport expect for purposes of scheduled medical appts or emergency trip to a hospital and if relocates that COC be informed within 24 hours or next business day of new address.  Atty Bennett statement to bond conditions to live with victim's mother wherever she resides.  Court sets over for preliminary hearing and notes time limits waived. adj: 11:46 a.m.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:11 PM Defendant Thomas James Dixon appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Thomas James Dixon. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion was filed to modify bond. Bennett/Schiek statement to bond. Court statement to bond - will take request under advisement. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing. Court statement to victim/victims mother. adj. 01:19 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Letter to Defendant re: Attorney Fees/Payments
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Reduction in Bond

records.addlTxt:
1:28 PM Defendant Thomas James Dixon appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court review of case. Defendant is not eligible for PD - is eligible for Court Appointed Counsel - has not received appointment yet. Bond continued. adj. 01:34 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:55 AM Defendant Thomas James Dixon appeared by video. Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint - has vision impairment - Court reads charges, right to counsel. Sowinski statement to bail. Court questions Defendant on address. Defendant statement to bond - has moved back in with victims mother. Court sets bond. adj. 11:06 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
